result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah Andrew Christoff #252432 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack March 29, 2020 - amend credit.

-Concurrent with Minnesota sentence.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #15CF513.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #15CF513.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea with defendant  Noah Andrew Christoff appeared from jail. On 15CF514 Atty Daniel Chapman appears with DE Melissa Heebink who appears in custody. Case called at 3:26 p.m. State calls Investigator James Haefner to the stand. S/T James Haefner. Direct by ADA Minser. Witness identifies Mr. Christoff and Ms. Heebink in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification of both defendant's. Cross by Atty Andrea. Direct by Atty Chapman. Witness excused at 3:39 p.m. No further evidence or witnesses by either party. State requesting a bind over.  Atty Andrea gives argument. ADA Minser gives response. Atty Chapman gives argument. Court finds probable cause on both files and binds defendant's over for trial. Atty Chapman would like to argue bond on 15CF514. Mother is present in the courtroom and would be willing to co-sign. ADA Minser objects. Court will amend bond to $10,000 cash, conditions to remain the same on 15CF514. Bond will remain as is on 15CF513.  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Preliminary hearing at 11-06-2015 03:15 pm

-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Melissa H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
